item.title: Imperial Finish Mile(s) Ahead
item.author: Fergus Johnson,
item.description: Just one day after their triumph at the Battle of Battersea, as previously reported by Felix, Imperial’s top athletes headed off to one of the iconic parts of London for the Westminster Mile, a legacy event from the 2012 Olympic Games. item.title: Need for Speed at BUCS Outdoor Athletics Champs
item.author: Fergus Johnson,
item.description: Over the Early May bank holiday weekend whilst students across the nation were locked indoors studying hard for exams, the country’s finest student athletes gathered at Bedford’s premium track for an ultimate athletics showdown. item.title: Imperial stay on track in LUCA Athletics League
item.author: Fergus Johnson,
item.description: A badly scheduled athletics calendar meant the second meet in the London Universities and Colleges Athletics (LUCA) Outdoors League fell on 20th April - Easter Saturday. Expectations of a severely depleted squad failed to materialise, however, with 9 stoic athletes still keen to compete at the Lee …

item.title: It’s in the Baggs! Imperial lift silverware after final race in the London Universities Cross Country League
item.author: Fergus Johnson,
item.description: It was a glorious Wednesday afternoon in the middle of February - the hottest winter day on record - which was no surprise to many of Imperial’s cross country runners who knew this competition had been hotting up for some time. item.title: Imperial Cross Country on verge of greatness with one race left in the LUCA XC League
item.author: Fergus Johnson,
item.description: As dawn broke on Alexandra Palace, the birds began to sing and the mud glistened brightly in the morning sun. item.title: Promising signs for ICXCAC as they begin 2019 with a successful training weekend
item.author: Fergus Johnson,
item.description: ICXCAC’s runners returned from the Christmas break in dire need of a training weekend, and 2019’s winter tour destination was Church Stretton – a quaint town just outside Shropshire’s county town of Shrewsbury. During the late Victorian period the small town was known as “Little Switzerland” and …

item.title: Cross country gives indoors athletics a try
item.author: Fergus Johnson,
item.description: This week Cross Country & Athletics ditched muddy hills to tackle some faster terrain - an indoor athletics track. The state-of-the-art Lee Valley Athletics Centre is situated amidst a desolate wasteland in the far reaches of north London. After meeting at Beit Quad to collect some of the famous …

item.title: ICXC regain Bannister Cup in final LXCL of 2018
item.author: Fergus Johnson,Aymeric Regnier,
item.description: Last Wednesday, 14th November, just two weeks after Mitcham Common’s sunny race, London’s sturdy athletes took out their spikes once more to compete in this term’s (and 2018’s) final LUCA Cross-Country League race, the much-anticipated Wimbledon Common. item.title: Cross Country Runs for Parliament (Hill)
item.author: Henry Hart,Fergus Johnson,
item.description: The first few weeks of October always seem to have surprisingly good weather to put the new freshers at ease, but eventually the first day of rain comes. item.title: UEFA Nations League: explained
item.author: Fergus Johnson,
item.description: This week the Premier League takes a break and the second round of fixtures in the all-new UEFA Nations League are taking place, but what even is the Nations League? item.title: Cross Country & Athletics’ Welsh Adventure
item.author: Fergus Johnson,
item.description: *wettest Imperial’s Cross Country & Athletics Club became the largest sports club at Imperial last year, and to celebrate both the end of a fantastic season and the start of another the club travelled to the north coast of Wales for their summer tour in the second week of September. item.title: ICXCAC – overtakes and underpasses
item.author: Fergus Johnson,
item.description: Sunday 11th March saw the intrepid ICXCAC runners head to the desolate wasteland of Milton Keynes for its annual festival of running. item.title: IC Cross Country and Athletics go on a Winter DorchesTour
item.author: Fergus Johnson,
item.description: It’s January again, and to offset the misery of the darkest mornings of the year Imperial’s Cross Country and Athletics Club once again had cunningly planned a weekend escape from the bustling capital to somewhere slightly quieter. Last year saw a minibus-load make the trek up North to Newcastle; …

item.title: Brighton-wards and upwards for ICXCAC
item.author: Fergus Johnson,
item.description: Sunday 19th November was the date of Imperial College Cross Country & Athletics Club’s first road race of the year: the Brighton 10k. item.title: ICXCAC Trail Team summit Mount Snowdon

item.title: Mud, sweat, and beers: the Cross-Country racing season begins at Parliament Hill
item.author: Fergus Johnson,
item.description: It was a dreary Wednesday afternoon, and a crowd of chilly-looking runners were gathering in Beit Quad, sporting distinctive navy and red vests rather than the gowns and mortarboards donned by a large proportion of the graduating students around campus. item.title: Cross Country and Athletics reach dizzying heights in the Pyrenees
item.author: Fergus Johnson,
item.description: On Wednesday 23rd August Imperial College’s Cross Country and Athletics team began to make their journey to their international summer tour. item.title: Keeping Track of Imperial’s Cross Country & Athletics Club
item.author: Lef Apostolakis,Fergus Johnson,
item.description: Saturday the 27th of May saw the final event in the London Universities and Colleges Athletics (LUCA) outdoors championship take place.
